#Text=Mary C. Tanner
#Text=Mary Catherine Tanner is an investment banker , with more than 25 years of experience on Wall Street .
#Text=She specializes in the areas of biotechnology , pharmaceuticals , and health care services . [ 4 ] [ 5 ]
#Text=Her expertise includes ethical pharmaceuticals and green technology . [ 1 ]
#Text=Fluent in both English and French , she specializes in cross-border transactions between large and small companies , corporate partnering and minority investments . [ 4 ] [ 5 ]
#Text=As of 2014 , Tanner was Senior Managing Director of EVOLUTION Life Science Partners ( ELSP ) , and a co-founder and chair of Life Science Partners LLP .
#Text=Previously she served as Senior Managing Director of Lehman Brothers , Bear Stearns , and the Peter J. Solomon Company . [ 4 ] [ 5 ]
#Text=Tanner was the first woman to become a partner at Lehman Brothers . [ 6 ]
#Text=She is credited with directing over 130 IPOs for life sciences organizations , [ 5 ] and over 500 mergers and acquisitions . [ 4 ]
#Text=Early life and education
#Text=Mary Catherine Tanner was born to Donald N. Tanner and Marilyn S. Tanner .
#Text=Her father was a civil engineer .
#Text=Her mother was an educator working with learning-disabled children . [ 3 ]
#Text=Tanner graduated from Harvard University in 1973 with a B.A. in philosophy , [ 6 ] [ 5 ] magna cum laude . [ 1 ]
#Text=Career
#Text=In 1978 , Tanner was included in a team at Lehman Brothers , to handle Humana 's acquisition of American Medicorp .
#Text=The team was led by Frederick Frank . [ 7 ]
#Text=Frank convinced Tanner to join his team at Lehman .
#Text=Ten years later , on October 15 , 1988 , they were married . [ 3 ]
#Text=Tanner became Senior Managing Director of Lehman Brothers , [ 1 ] while Frank became vice chair of Lehman Brothers .
#Text=Frank and Tanner worked together at Lehman for over ten years , until Tanner took time off to have a child . [ 2 ]
#Text=Tanner returned to work as the Senior Managing Director at Bear Stearns as of 2000 , [ 2 ] and retired from Bear Stearns in 2004 , to found Life Sciences Partners . [ 8 ]
#Text=As of March 18 , 2009 , Mary Tanner and Frederick Frank joined Peter J. Solomon , of PJ SOLOMON to form a new practice focusing on pharmaceuticals and life sciences . [ 9 ]
#Text=Tanner became a managing director at Peter J. Solomon , while Frank became a vice chairman . [ 10 ]
#Text=As of January 15 , 2013 , Mary Tanner and Frederick Frank joined Burrill & Company . [ 11 ]
#Text=Tanner became the Senior Managing Director of Burrill Securities and of Burrill & Company . [ 11 ] [ 6 ]
#Text=As of 2014 , Tanner and Frank founded EVOLUTION Life Science Partners ( ELSP ) . [ 12 ]
#Text=Tanner is Senior Managing Director of EVOLUTION Life Science Partners ( ELSP ) , and a co-founder and chair of Life Science Partners LLP . [ 4 ]
#Text=Tanner has served on numerous advisory groups and boards of directors . [ 6 ]
#Text=She is credited with over 130 IPOs [ 5 ] and over 500 mergers and acquisitions for life sciences organizations . [ 4 ]

#Text=During her time at Lehmann , Tanner represented Rhône-Poulenc when it acquired Rorer for $ 1.8 billion in 1990 , and in 1995 represented Rhône-Poulenc Rorer when it acquired Fisons for £1.8 billion . [ 5 ] [ 11 ]
#Text=Together , Tanner and Frederick Frank represented Marion Merrell Dow in its merger with Hoechst AG , forming Hoechst Marion Roussel , Inc. in 1995 . [ 11 ]
#Text=While at Bear Stearns , Tanner represented Pfizer when it acquired Pharmacia for $ 60 billion ( 2002-2003 ) . [ 9 ] [ 13 ]
#Text=She also represented Amgen when it acquired Immunex for $ 16 billion . [ 5 ] [ 11 ]
#Text=Philanthropy
#Text=As of October , 1997 , the non-profit Tanner Frank Foundation of New York City was granted charitable status . [ 14 ]
#Text=Tanner has served on the Dean 's Council for the Yale School of Medicine and on the advisory board for the Yale School of Management ( SOM ) . [ 5 ]

#Text=Tanner and Frank have made multiple gifts to Yale , [ 14 ] including early career support of researchers in autism at the Yale School of Medicine , [ 15 ] and the creation of the Frank and Tanner Professor of Management at the Yale School of Management , to which Olav Sorenson was appointed on April 9 , 2012 . [ 16 ]
#Text=Awards and honors
#Text=2012 , Oracle award , Springboard Enterprises , [ 17 ] [ 18 ] for professional accomplishment and mentoring of women entrepreneurs . [ 1 ]
